problem_text: Let d(G) denote the smallest cardinality of a generating set of the group G. Suppose that G = ⟨A, B⟩, where A and B are two d-generated finite groups of coprime orders. Is it true that d(G) ⩽ d + 1? See Archive 12.71 and (A. Lucchini, J. Algebra, 245 (2001), 552–561). Comment of 2021: the answer is yes if A and B have prime power order (E. Detomi, A. Lucchini, J. London Math. Soc. (2), 87, no. 3 (2013), 689–706). A. Lucchini
